subject: Migrate to meson build
commitMessage:
Migrate to meson build

This commit focuses in enabling the meson build for the
phosphor-snmp repo.

To build and install using meson:
  meson build
  ninja -C build
  ninja -C build install

Tested By:
  meson -Dtests=enabled build
  ninja -C build test

Signed-off-by: Ratan Gupta <ratankgupta31@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I8268d7067234033d97bcbe63bf525e4cf81aebd8

Patch Set 3:

Unit tests are failing, it was working before but with this commit it is failing.
If I keep all the test then all other tests fail with the following error which suggest that duplicate bus name and the last test timeout, and if I keep only one test then it is always timedout.

stderr:
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'sdbusplus::exception::SdBusError'
  what():  sd_bus_request_name: org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.FileExists: File exists
------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Any expert comments??

Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> Unit tests are failing, it was working before but with this commit it is failing.
> If I keep all the test then all other tests fail with the following error which suggest that duplicate bus name and the last test timeout, and if I keep only one test then it is always timedout.
> 
> stderr:
> terminate called after throwing an instance of 'sdbusplus::exception::SdBusError'
>   what():  sd_bus_request_name: org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.FileExists: File exists
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
> 
> Any expert comments??

I would have expected this being due to multiple unit tests running in parallel and attempting to get the same busname, but that doesn't necessarily appear to be the case...

```
$ git grep request_name
snmp_main.cpp:    bus.request_name(BUSNAME_NETWORK_SNMP);
```

Where are the `sd_bus_request_name` calls even coming from during the tests?

Patch Set 3:

>

I don't see that the sd_bus_request_name is being called during the tests, Patrick If I remove all the test and keep only one test then it is getting timedout.

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> > > > stderr:
> > > > terminate called after throwing an instance of 'sdbusplus::exception::SdBusError'
> > > >   what():  sd_bus_request_name: org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.FileExists: File exists

> > 
> > I don't see that the sd_bus_request_name is being called during the tests, Patrick If I remove all the test and keep only one test then it is getting timedout.
> 
> I'm lost.  We're throwing an error that can only be created from this sdbusplus code:
> 
>     /** @brief Claim a service name on the dbus.
>      *
>      *  @param[in] service - The service name to claim.
>      */
>     void request_name(const char* service)
>     {
>         int r = _intf->sd_bus_request_name(_bus.get(), service, 0);
>         if (r < 0)
>         {
>             throw exception::SdBusError(-r, "sd_bus_request_name");
>         }
>     }

It has been solved, now the CI has been passed.
Thanks Patrick for the review.
As phosphor-snmp is migrated to meson, abandoned this commit.

After this commit you might want to revise how this is done.  We've generally been reducing these kind of configurations.  It is kind of pointless to have a bunch of code in meson for what is effectively a constant in a header file.
Sure, Let me fix this with separate commit
Are you going to add a wrap file for this?  Seems rather pointless to have all the wrapfiles if it still isn't going to work.
your suggestion is to remove the other wrap file too?

Well, no, ideally you'd _add_ a wrap file for net-snmp.  I don't think you should remove the ones you have at this point.  But, the fact that you have them would have implied to me that you somehow tested them... which you probably didn't if this one is missing.

Yes, I tested to compile this and I didn't hit the issue related to netsnmp as it was already there on my build system.

Ack
These aren't needed by libsnmp?  I'm a little surprised.
Yes, libsnmp is the shared library where we are only giving the function to send the trap with the data, hence we don't need all other source files.

I don't really understand how this has more content than libsnmp on line 97 (additional src files) but has less dependencies (missing libnetsnmp).  Is this really correct?  If so, why does libsnmp need libnetsnmp?

snmp_lib is providing the Dbus daemon to configure the Dbus clients.
libsnmp : Caller(bmc services) needs to call the function sendTrap with the data which needs to be sent to the snmp trap daemon.
Doesn't there need to be a 'requires' line?
Let me see this.
Is this really interesting to configure?  Does anyone?  I'd probably follow up and remove this as a configuration option.

I don't think so it should be configurable, should be hardcoded in the code.
I will fix this up as a separate commit.
Maybe decrease the line length a little.
Done
